gurmukhi: ਦੲੀ ਰਕਤ ਨੀਲੰ ਮਣੀ ਰੰਗ ਰੰਗੰ ॥ ਲਖਯੋ ਰਾਮ ਕੋ ਅੱਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੀ ਅਭੰਗੰ ॥੬੮੪॥
transliteration: Dairakat Neelan Maniran Ranadg|| Lakhyo Raam Ko Attra Dhaariabhanadg||684||
translation: The kings, who presented multi-coloured red and blue gems, had a sight of Ram, the wielder of weapons and arms.684.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਪਸਮ ਪਾਟੰਬਰੰ ਸ੍ਵਰਣ ਬਰਣੰ ॥ ਮਿਲੇ ਭੇਟ ਲੈ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਭਾਂਤੰ ਅਭਰਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Kite Pasam Paatanbaran Svaran Baranan|| Mile Bhet Lai Bhaant(i) Bhaantan Abharanan||
translation: Somewhere the kings are meeting Ram with golden colored silken raiments and various types of ornaments;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਪਰਮ ਪਾਟੰਬਰੰ ਭਾਨ ਤੇਜੰ ॥ ਦੲੇ ਸੀਅ ਧਾਮੰ ਸਭੋ ਭੋਜ ਭੋਜੰ ॥੬੮੫॥
transliteration: Kite Param Paatanbaran Bhaan Tejan|| Dae Seea Dhaamannd Sabho Bhej Bhejan||685||
translation: Somewhere the garments shining like sun are being sent to the abode of Sita.685.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਭੂਖਣੰ ਭਾਨ ਤੇਜੰ ਅਨੰਤੰ ॥ ਪਠੇ ਜਾਨਕੀ ਭੇਟ ਦੈ ਦੈ ਦੁਰੰਤੰ ॥
transliteration: Kite Bhookhanan Bhaan Tejan Anantan|| Pathaa Jaanakibhet Dai Dai Durantan||
translation: Somewhere the ornaments shining like sun are being sent to Sita;

gurmukhi: ਘਨੇ ਰਾਮ ਮਾਤਾਨ ਕੀ ਭੇਟ ਭੇਜੇ ॥ ਹਰੇ ਚਿੱਤ ਕੇ ਜਾਹਿ ਹੇਰੇ ਕਲੇਜੇ ॥੬੮੬॥
transliteration: Ghane Raam Maataan Kibhet Bheje|| Dare Chitt Ke Jaah(i) Dere Kaleje||686||
translation: Many ornaments and garments were sent to the mothers of Ram, seeing which many became covetous in their hearts.686.

gurmukhi: ਘਮੰ ਚਕ੍ਰ ਚੱਕ੍ਰੰ ਫਿਰੀ ਰਾਮ ਦੋਹੀ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਬਯੋਤ ਬਾਗੋ ਤਿਮੰ ਸੀਅ ਸੋਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Ghamannd Charka Chakkran Phiriraam Kohee|| Mano Byot Baago Timan Seea Sohee||
translation: On all the four sides, revolving the canopies, declarations were made regarding Ram and SIta also looked splendid like a decorated garden.

gurmukhi: ਪਠੈ ਛੱਤ੍ਰ ਦੈ ਦੈ ਛਿਤੰ ਛੋਣ ਧਾਰੀ ॥ ਹਰੇ ਸਰਬ ਗਰਬੰ ਕਰੇ ਪੁਰਬ ਭਾਰੀ ॥੬੮੭॥
transliteration: Padhhai Chhattra Dai Dai Chhitan Chhodh Dhdaree|| Dare Sarab Gadaban Dare Purab Bhdaree||687||
translation: The kings were sent to far off places with to canopy of Ram, they smashed the pride of all and arranged festivities.687.

gurmukhi: ਕਟਯੋ ਕਾਲ ੲੇਵੰ ਭੲੇ ਰਾਮ ਰਾਜੰ ॥ ਫਿਰੀ ਅਾਨ ਰਾਮੰ ਸਿਰੰ ਸਰਬ ਰਾਜੰ ॥
transliteration: Katyo Kaal Evan Bhae Raam Raajan|| Phiriaan Raamannd Siran Sarab Raajan||
translation: In this way sufficient time elapsed in Ram’s kingdom and Ram began to rule magnificently;

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿਯੋ ਜੈਤ ਪਤ੍ਰੰ ਸਿਰੰ ਸੇਤ ਛੱਤ੍ਰੰ ॥ ਕਰੇ ਰਾਜ ਅਾਗਿਅਾ ਧਰੈ ਬੀਰ ਅੱਤ੍ਰੰ ॥੬੮੮॥
transliteration: Phiriyo Jait Patran Siran Set Chattran|| Dare Raaj Aageeaa Ddarai Beer Attran||688||
translation: Letters of victory were sent to all sides and under a white canopy and commanding Ram looked greatly impressive.688.

gurmukhi: ਦਯੋ ੲੇਕ ੲੇਕੰ ਅਨੇਕੰ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰੰ ॥ ਲਖੇ ਸਰਬ ਲੋਕੰ ਸਹੀ ਰਾਵਣਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Dayo Ek Ekan Anekan Prakaaran|| Lakhe Sarab Lokan Sahiraavanaaran||
translation: Everyone was given wealth in various ways and the people saw the real personality of Ram.

gurmukhi: ਸਹੀ ਬਿਸਨ ਦੇਵਾਰਦਨ ਦ੍ਰੋਹ ਹਰਤਾ ॥ ਚਹੂੰ ਚੱਕ ਜਾਨਯੋ ਸੀਅਾ ਨਾਥ ਭਰਤਾ ॥੬੮੯॥
transliteration: Sahibisan Devaardan Droh Hartaa|| Chahoon Chhak Jaanyo Seeaa Naath Bhartaa||689||
translation: He was known on all four direction as the destroyer of the rebels of Vishnu and the lord of Sita.689.

gurmukhi: ਸਹੀ ਬਿਸਨ ਅੳੁਤਾਰ ਕੈ ਤਾਹਿ ਜਾਨਯੋ ॥ ਸਭੋ ਲੋਕ ਖਯਾਤਾ ਬਿਧਾਤਾ ਪਛਾਨਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Sahaa Bisan Aoutaar Kai Taah(i) Jaanyo|| Sobho Lok Khyaataa Bidhaataa Pachhaadyo||
translation: Everyone considered him as an incarnation of Vishnu and he was famous among the people as the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰੀ ਚਾਰ ਚੱਕ੍ਰੰ ਚਤੁਰ ਚੱਕ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੰ ॥ ਭਯੋ ਚੱਕ੍ਵਰਤੀ ਭੂਅੰ ਰਾਵਣਾਰੰ ॥੬੯੦॥
transliteration: Phirichaar Chakkran Chatur Chakkra Dhaaran|| Bhayo Chakkravartibhooan Raavanaaran||690||
translation: In all the four directions the current of Ram’s praise flowed as he , the enemy of Ravana, was known as the Supreme Soverign.690.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਯੋ ਪਰਮ ਜੋਗਿੰਦ੍ਰਣੋ ਜੋਗ ਰੂਪੰ ॥ ਮਹਾਦੇਵ ਦੇਵੰ ਲਖਯੋ ਭੂਪ ਭੂਪੰ ॥
transliteration: Lakhyo Param Jogindrano Jog Roopan|| Mahaadev Devan Lakhyo Bhoop Bhoopan||
translation: He looked like a supreme Yogi amongst Yogis, great god anong gods and a supreme sovereign amongst kings.
